intro: Dorstenia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian woodspurry, is a tropical plant native to South America, particularly Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Dorstenia boliviana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its interesting foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional practices.
